If you ask someone for something then s/he will send you the next counter. There is not adequate seating capacity in the premises. Patents have to stand in front of doctors chamber. The hospital is similar to a little clinic. All the department rooms are very small, you can't even stand ( don't dare to think about sitting) comfortably. Even security guards' behaviour is better than the hospital stuff. 
Hospital test charges are sky kissing. Docs' min visit is 1000. I have visited many renowned hospitals but sorry to say I have to categorise this so called hospital as a POLYCLINIC.
All sisters and brothers also so cooperative and excellent behavour. I am really so happy. May God. Bless you and keep I also. Thank you AMRI all staffs.

ÔøºAMRI Hospital, Mukundapur, a state-of-the-art facility, is situated barely 300 metres off the Eastern Metropolitan By-pass. The swanky, glass-front building -- a tribute to modern medicine - is among the top tertiary care healthcare units in Eastern India, providing a host of specialties only a handful of hospitals offer.

AMRI-Mukundapur, which started its clinical operations from March 25, 2011, soon emerged as one of the best hospitals in Kolkata. The unit has been providing quality healthcare at value-for-money rates to not just people from in and around Kolkata but also from North-Eastern India, neighbouring countries, such as Bangladesh, Nepal and Myanmar, and even from as far as Africa and the Pacific region.

Spread over around 1.20 lakh square feet, the 180-bed hospital was among the first in Eastern India to claim Green OT certification on May 28, 2016, and earned its accreditation from the NABH in February 2017. With a roster of top experts from various fields of clinical and surgical treatment, the hospital boasts of a well-trained support and paramedical staff, working seamlessly in a technology-driven facility.

In January 2018, AMRI-Mukundapur, one of the best hospitals in Kolkata, joined the elite club of a handful of Indian hospitals who boast of possessing O-ARM technology, the latest in surgical precision. The hospital added another feather to its cap by completing 300-plus laser surgeries in proctology within 16 months, since February 2017. AMRI-Mukundapur has always been at the forefront of technology-backed healthcare protocols, introducing latest technologies that would benefit patients, not just for more precise treatment but also to save time.

AMRI-Mukundapur's dedication towards use of advanced technologies is part of an endeavour to keep the hospital updated with the latest tools available in healthcare so that patients can receive the best available resources, painlessly and fast. With a focus on precision and targeted treatments, AMRI-Mukundapur is among the handful of hospitals in Eastern India to have an advanced Paediatric ICU, with high-tech equipment, which continues to infuse new life in children and brings back smiles to the faces of their parents.

With a special focus on wellbeing of children, the hospital has launched a number of integrated clinics under its paediatric department, addressing important conditions such as Bed-wetting, Growth & Obesity, Nephrotic Syndrome, Nephro-Urology, and Speech & Hearing. The hospital is one of the best ENT hospital in Kolkata, runs highly- specified clinics for Voice, Swallowing and Airway for both children and adults. AMRI-Mukundapur has also achieved the privilege of being the first centre outside the United Kingdom to conduct the examination for Diploma in Child Health. The hospital also uses technology to reduce its carbon footprint, ensuring that its eco-friendly campus is among the top scorers in Energy Performance Index and holds a Star rating for buildings.

AMRI-Mukundapur will soon extend its services to an annexe building next to the existing hospital and will be able to accommodate around 300 more patients, providing quality healthcare services that have become its hallmark. The hospital is also looking at earning an accreditation from the NABL for its pathological lab, and ISO accreditation for its kitchen, which will provide healthy, nutritious, and tasty meals for its patients and visitors.

Very much Annoyed with Staff behaviour. At admission, Discharge and Security staff behaves like they are doing charity work.  At the time of discharge the security staff behaviour was such as if we are trespassing. You take one slip from here one slip from there, talk to that person that person does not know that, talk in next counter wait here - whats the point ? 

It's a hospital, but every staff forgot 'hospitality'.
However there are exception - TPA and Doctor are only two person I met who treated us like human. 

 Please look at it like this - we are paing x  ammount of money to get the treatment done. It must be your duty to get the job done smoothly done. You ppl are not doing anything close to charity right ? Then why such behaviour? Don't make it a chaotic process. 

It's your's and ours home town, can't we make this better place?

reviews.text: Worst hospital in the entire locality. They do not have the very common sense of treating patients and their families properly. I do not suggest this hospital to anyone.

Infrastructure was ok and clean. However, staff's behaviours are really bad. Hate to say this but this medical facility has worst staffs. They are not helpful and most of them has very bad attitude as if they own it. Doctors facility is good but if you are looking for specialist then this is just not the place. Also, its location is a problem. You either have take a Taxi or book a Cab to get there, cause by walking it takes a lot. There are no transport facility available near the hospital. If you're with a patient who cannot walk or have problem walking, then you have to book a vehicle. Several payment methods are available there and they also have TPA (Third Party Administration) facility or Mediclaim Facility. I visited maternity ward and the nurses there was totally rude. However, the caretakers were nice. They do not allow the patient to carry a mobile phone or cellphone, it is strictly prohibited. The bathrooms are clean and cleaning stuffs do their job very well. Though the facility has many draw backs but they give a standard class treatment. They have 24x7 emergency but I doubt that you will find doctors always. Also outoutside the hospital there are no food stalls so you better bring something to eat unless you want walk 500-600metres to Hiland Park. They have a food stall at the entrance of the hospital but the food there is expensive and mostly wasted and taste very bad. Overall I will say that the facility is not up to the mark and I doubt that they can provide advance treatment. For small cases it is ok to go there but for serious cases I personally will not suggest this hospital to anyone.

Totally disappointed with staff behaviour... I can rate doctors 5 out of 5... But apart from that all sections are not even 1 out 5... Discharge process is too much time consuming in this nursing home... You can't even imagine how much you have to wait for discharge.... staffs behaviour of reception,TPA are quite rude... they are just doing this like business they don't have any professionalism and kindness...
very nice.you will not feel it is a hospital.The cordial behablviour of the staff and nurse is amazing.It is near E.M.Bypass and for this reason the communication system is good enough.
Cleaning department  and staff are good..service is good..dr. are careful about their patient..staff do their job carefully and friendly atmosphere..

reviews.text: One of the worst hospitals I've seen in my life. No infrastructure, no doctor, no nurse is there in the hospital. Hospital bills are exorbitant but at the end of the day your patient will not receive any treatment! The most tragic part is, any patient that enters the hospital never comes out alive! The only doctor present in the hospital is Dr. Hashvardhan Agarwal (the owner) and he treats all the patients irrespective of their illness. He's the cardiologist, the orthopedic, the general medicine doctor, the diabetic consultant and everything. And the result is no patient comes out alive. Never ever go to this hospital and the locality is even worse. It's located amidst a slum. If Google had the option of negative marking I would have gone with that for this hospital!

They gave him immeasurable high doses of antibiotics in a week span causing to have sepsis and multi-organ failure. They were doing tests to receive more money from the insurance company even while he went into brain-stock. I would not ask anybody to ever go to this hospital EVER !!!! I am giving it a star because I have to otherwise it would not be posted. They are very cunning educated robbers in disguise of doctor and medical staffs. They try to keep their patients admitted there until the patient and their family members are broken down and financially finished. If they know you have High coverage Insurance plan, then They will make sure to use full cover no matter how it impact the patient and their family and even for that they intentionally keep the patient in extreme situation to show it on bill They took 1hr to shift unconscious patient from general ward to ICU. All nurses were busy to vacant and clean that general ward, but were not to get ready to take the patient in ICU which should be their highest priority. While in serious condition of patient, all emergency/night doctor were sleeping and in next 2hr patient was no more just because of them as they didn't responded on time in such critical case. They hided their treatment, also the medicine they have provided.Dr Syamasis Bandyopadhyay, who has given many high power antibiotics and which causes multi organ failed including kidney. Hospital has good communication within doctors for all humours and jokes but they don't know their duties and responsibilities. reviews.text:
CMRI (The Calcutta Medical Research Institute) ‚Äî the flagship hospital of the CK Birla Group of Hospitals, has been a strong name in providing health care services for over 50 years. This multi-speciality tertiary unit is based on three key principals ‚ÄîClinical Excellence, Ethical Conduct and Patient Centricity. Going beyond National borders; to Bangladesh, Bhutan, Nepal and Myanmar, this institution is a hallmark of trust in the medical sector.

Centrally located with 440 beds and state-of-the-art infrastructure, CMRI is an ISO 9001:2008 certified hospital accredited by the NABH, NABL & CAP (College of American Pathologists) recognised for its Quality Healthcare Service Delivery.

reviews.text: Nice place, good environment, big hospital campus area. Treatment is so good in a very low cost. This hospital is run by charitable trust. This hospital has every Sophisticated facilities for patients to treat well. So many units. Available staff for better service.

Extremely disappointed with the standard of treatment in this hospital. Firstly the statements of the doctors were extremely contradictory. Initially we were explained about the procedure of the treatment which was quite convincing but later on the treatment didn't proceed in the way we were initially told. The first doctor, Dr. Chandan Kumar Shith whom we met said that bone marrow test wasn't required but a test called PET CT scan would be done to detect the cause of infection. Three to four days passed but no test was done. Finally in Doctor's meet , when we asked again that when will the PET- CT scan be done , the doctor said that PET - CT won't be done instead bone marrow test might be required. We were totally puzzled by the remarks of those two doctors. Finally in the doctor's meet just before the day of discharge,we met Dr. Nilratan Naiya. Already 7 days were over but the cause of infection which caused the prolonged fever and the sudden fall in WBC count to 1300 was undiagnosed. I asked him,
"Doctor, where is the infection in my mother's body?" to which he replied nonchalantly that they were still in the dark,the cause being undiagnosed. This angered me like anything,how could he talk so casually was completely beyond my understanding. Then asked him "This means you could diagnose nothing , isn't it ? Seven days is quite a lot of time to diagnose the cause. This made him bubble with rage and he started shouting and behaving rudely. His answer should have been a simple "no". Then somehow we got to know from him PET CT is not done in this hospital. Just imagine!  Such an important piece of information was not given to us earlier. We didn't expect such rudeness and arrogance from any senior doctor. Secondly the Residential RMO Dr. Debarati Biswas's behaviour was extremely annoying. Absolutely mannerless. Thirdly,the nurses should be much more compassionate and empathetic towards the patient. Except two nurses in CCU whose names I don't know, others in the ITU and ICU ward were least bothered  about the discomforts of the patient. They didn't even bother to insert the saline lock properly and as a result it started  to disfunction and there was a lot of blood loss. The saline lock had to be inserted five  or six times due to their inefficiency and the sufferer was my mother. One expects a little bit of care and compassion from them not this type of recklessness. Fourthly, the food served was substandard in both quality and taste. When they're charging so much money, they shouldn't at least compromise on the quality of food. Next , the hospital is highly expensive. The bed charges are extremely high. Last but not the least, there's no waiting arrangement for the family members of the patient. They can arrange for a few plastic chairs. This simple step can solve the problem but they're least bothered. Highly disheartened. I hope that the concerned authorities will take this matter seriously and will work hard to minimise their drawbacks and inefficiencies.

I wish, I could give it zero star. Worst hospital l have ever seen. Intentionally makes prolonged treatment which detoriate the condition of the patient and unnecessary pathological tests without any proper diagnosis. Very unprofessional and poor treatment available. Never ever visit this hospital.

Cannot be more grateful. The hospital is very neat an clean. The doctors are very efficient and polite. The staff including the nurses, security guards, and everyone who practically work there are very helpful. Thank you. 

Highly recommend this hospital.

Historic Day in #IndiaBangladesh Maritime Cooperation 

State Minister for Shipping Mansukh Mandviya flagged off 1st trial run of container ship from Kolkata to Chattogram. Cargo will be carried to Agartala from Chattogram in Bangladeshi trucks. 

This win-win connectivity partnership will generate revenue & create jobs and investment opportunities in logistics sector for Bangladesh. It will also reduce time and cost of transportation to North East India.

Kolkata port also known as Netaji Subhash Dock (NSD). It is river port with lock gate. 

Pilotage is compulsory from way point No.7 to Berth. Normally three types pilotage available during Arr and Dep. 1. River pilot. 2. Dock pilot. 3. Harbour pilot. From Anchorage sand heads WCLV to NS Dock distance around 120 NM. Always follow Sagar VTS on CH - 68 and SSB 4147.4 kHz. AIS plug should be in order for pilotage.

reviews.text:
Private hospitals are actually having a good business during this covid situation. For OPD patients, while they enter the hospital, an extra checkup is being done for an extra charge of Rs 150/-(mandatory).
The so called "extra checkup" is to have a temparature check and followed by a 2-3 minutes of small discussion to know patient\'s history. Seriously !!!! Does this process actually need to be given a price tag and imposed on patients??

Why these are not arranged and handled by the hospital administration... Not only Charnock, all private hospitals are of same category.

This Hospital is growing day by day, my mother was admitted with Leg injury and got proper treatment, the Doctor was excellent and Nursing Staff's are very caring, but front office staff's are very unprofessional,  they don't have manners to talk with the relatives of patients who are very anxious, the security staff's (Crew) don't know how to give respect, they are always in ordering mood, no politeness. Hospital Management should arrange for proper grooming and training of these staff's. One more thing billing to patient is an art to them as no one is there to check or verify the same.

Was a good hospital pre corona. Now in the midst of corona a hotbed and epicentre of the virus near megacity. Went there for ct scan but when I just learnt from the security guard and opd receptionist department that ct scan is taking place in the same building (building number 1) at the ground floor. 4th floor is where corona patients are getting treated.Obviously huge risk of a healthy person getting infected from the virus..Immiediately moved out from there and went to other diagonistic centre for ct scan..

First of all I would like to express my wish towards all the employees of this hospital.... my wish is.... family members specially very close one of each of the employee of this hospital face the same treatment at their severe condition.... My wish, they be treated as atm machines only.. not as a patient.... and end of the circus they die the same way like my patient died.....

This building is known as hospital.... registered as a hospital to give treatment to all patients.. but eventually it is  not a hospital it is a genuine  high quality BUTCHER SHOP....

Overall a good hospital. However, the building no. 1 desperately needs improvement. There is no fan for patient party waiting on the landings of the staircases. The relatives of the patients who is undergoing an operation are asked to wait on the third floor landing. There is no fan over there and if one has to wait for a couple of hours there, it becomes unbearable as they are required to host an army of mosquitoes who goes on a rampage seeing the availability of easy prey. Otherwise the hospital is good and the employees and doctors over there are very cooperative.

It is a very nice hospital.and many benefits are available here.üè™üè©üè®

Global canvas, local colours‚Äîthat is what we, at Glocal, simply believe in. It is the prism that refracts all our endeavours ‚Äî whether it is our architecture, curriculum design, pedagogy, hostel life, laboratories, caf√© or the library. In short, we simply celebrate the liminal space where the ‚Äòglobal‚Äô meets the ‚Äòlocal‚Äô. We are traditional, yet we are not. We are modern, yet we are not really so. We understand the hybrid nature of the global workplace and that is why no barriers constrain us. To flourish in the world today, one cannot afford substantive and rigid visions of the good life. One has to appreciate the negotiated nature of the contemporary. That is why we emphasise reflexivity, flexibility, diversity and accommodation as key values. While that is the ethos of critical engagement, we aspire to craft, we are equally keen to develop top quality doctors for dedicated patient care.

At the Glocal Medical College Super Specialty Hospital &Research Center, we are committed to producing top- notch doctors who have a zeal for perpetual learning and are capable of performing well in diverse professional and cultural settings. While we provide the students with all the tools required to successfully take on the world, we also endeavour to instil in them a healthy cultural rootedness that combines the best of traditional values with modern and progressive sensibilities.

Medical College and Hospital, Kolkata or Calcutta Medical College is a state government funded college of Medicine. It was founded in 1835 as Medical College, Bengal in Kolkata. The college was the first ever to offer a degree in European medicine in Asia. It is affiliated to the West Bengal University of Health Sciences, Kolkata. The college is located at College Street in Kolkata, Paschim Bangla. It offers 3 UG degrees as of now and has been recognised as one of the oldest and most prestigious medical colleges in India. From 2013 onwards, admission to the college is slated to be based on the rank scored in the All India Level NEET.
This is the first medical college of south east Asia. It is good college for MBBS,MD,MS courses..It is a good hospital too.

Post its inception in 1977, Mercy is a leading healthcare organization with its presence in West Bengal, Odisha and Jharkhand. The hospital has aligned itself in the process to spread healthcare to the remotest areas of the state. The NABH Accredited and NABH Nursing Excellence Certified, organization has a dedicated team of doctors, nurses, partners with long standing well wishers and education based institutions from across the globe. On its journey from a small clinic to a173 bed facility, Mercy Healthcare nurtured and sustained a unique healthcare delivery model through a network of 17 rural clinics. They are low cost and subsidized treatment model delivered through partnerships collaborated through six urban clinics centres and a competitively marked to market‚Äô priced delivery model for sustainability through multi- specialty hospital. The history of hospital, committed to provide affordable healthcare to its patients and innovative leadership combine to make Mercy Healthcare a model healthcare network. Set up by visionaries, Mercy Healthcare has over the last four decades followed the philosophy of caring for the underserved in Kolkata. Today, the hospital offers variety of services including a complete surgical facility (General surgery, Orthopaedic, Obstetrics, Gynaecology and Neuro-surgery), three critical care units (ICCU, ITU, NICU), a mother & child centre, an emergency centre followed by a medical and general centres. With a strong legacy behind, Mercy Healthcare does not cater to the city‚Äôs population alone; their reach is the entire state. Patients from various districts like Malda, Midnapore, Burdwan, Birbhum, Bongaon, Asansol, Purulia and North Bengal access our services. Patients from neighbouring states like Odisha and Jharkhand and neighbouring countries like Bangladesh also visit the hospital. Since 1979 it operates a School of Nursing, which is affiliated to West Bengal Nursing Council and recognized by The Indian Nursing Council. West Bengal Government empanelled Mercy Healthcare as a Class- I Medical Service Provider in the year 2011. To perform best in an increasingly competitive market, the hospital is committed to serve people through ‚ÄòCompassion with Excellence‚Äô. The Hospital is certified as ISO 9001 : 2000 QMS, ISO 9001 : 2008 QMS, ISO 14001: 2004 EMS & OHSAS 18001 :2007.

reviews.text: My uncle was admitted recently as he was diagnosed with COVID19. We were very scared because we could not get a bed in any hospital. Reshmi helped us a lot she is a patient coordinator and guided us to get a bed. This was very lucky for us otherwise my uncle may not be alive today. He is well and has recovered. There was one small issue with AC temperature being too cold but once we informed the staff they were quick to resolve the issue. We very much appreciate the staff at Ohio Hospital. In such stressful and difficult situations, we really felt that they care about our family and were always sharing information with us about our loved one. I would recommend anyone to go to Ohio, especially during this difficult coronavirus period where many beds and medicines are not available.

Can I give less than 1 star?

Try avoiding

Woodlands Multispecialty Hospital -{Sate.name: Woodlands Multispeciality Hospital Limited

reviews.text: Visiting 2/3 times a year since last 7 years. Feel very comfortable . Charges are reasonable. Doctors we visit are very efficient and helpful.

Being a multi-speciality hospital there is so many good thing is clearly noticable, such as Out-patient service (OPD care) is appreciated, Receptionists are contact you over phone if any changes of doctors appointments and notify for other information. There is no separate urinal/toilet/lavatory for gents and ladies, it's quite disappointing.Hospital has facilities like waiting hall, cafeteria, lounge is to accommodate much patients and their family members. The main highlight is Doctors are very good, carefull, responsible and obviously one can get good treatment from here.

THE BILLING SECTION IS PATHETIC. THE ARE A MAXIMUM OF TWO PERSONAL BEHIND THE COUNTER. MOST OFTEN JUST ONE. 
THE LINE FOR WITH PEOPLE WAITING TO PAY KEEPS ON GROWING. THIS CAUSES ALOT OF HARASSMENT AND NUMEROUS PEOPLE HAVE EXPRESSED THEIR PROBLEMS HAVING TO STAND IN LINE FOR AN INDEFFINATE PERIOD OF TIME. THE MANAGEMENT REFUSES TO HELP. TWO PERSONAL ARE NOT ENOUGH AT THE BILLING COUNTER FOR SUCH A LARGE OUT PATIENT DEPARTMENT. ONE FEELS LIKE CHANNELLING THE APPOINTMENT AND GOING TO SOME OTHER MEDICAL FACILITY. 
STANDING IN LINE IN WOODLANDS O.P.D. IS ITSELF A TRAUMATIC EXPERIENCE. ABSOLUTELY THIRD CLASS.

Such a pathetic service.. They are charging money for Doctor's PPE KIT from every patient coming for outdoor treatment.. Doctor is using one kit at a single seisson but money is paid by all patients on every seisson.. Such a funny scam.. 
Stop doing unethical business..

reviews.text: One of the best Hospital at north kolkata. Specifically the maternity unit is superb. All the staffs are very good. But I think infrastructure can be modified comparing the charges. But overall experience is excellent in maternity unit at ZENITH.

Very good hospital with great infrastructure. It has also cashless facility , so if you have mediclaim policy against your name then you need not to worry about treatment. Doctors are very polite and helpful. They have great expertise in operation and they take care of patients after post operation. Then location of the hospital is great. It is very well connected with city. Overall in my experience zenith hospital is take very good care of you against a affordable price.

One of the worst nursing home ever. My mother was admitted with an emergency. During 3 days treatment they made a bill of 45k and did nothing. After returning from hospital my mother condition became worse than before. They use old machines and technology for tests as well .. on the day of colonoscopy my mother was almost dead. They did no local anasthesia nothing .. she suffered a lot.. i recommend to go anywhere but not here. Dr. BINAY GUCHHAIT told that may be she has a colon infection during the time of releasing her later it turned out extreme dangerous disease and she had to go through surgery as well.
here have a lift but the rule is patient can't use the lift...most important thing is sometimes security guards are too worst.

Best hospital in north kolkata. All facilities available in one roof. Friendly atmosphere, supportive ground staff & qualified & well experienced physicians & surgeons team available.Most important is hospitality cleanliness which is very good, Awesome. But one thing PRICE is quite high for all stuff.
